Key Arguments: The legislation lacks clarity on who decides what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
There is no clear mechanism for entities to challenge rulings or have their information reinstated.
The legislation could be used by the government to control narratives and suppress freedom of speech.
The involvement of multinational corporations like Microsoft in combating misinformation is seen as problematic due to their vested interests.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to democracy and freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: This amending legislation (and even the original) is completely out of order.
It opens the door for the government of the day to set and cultivate whatever narrative it chooses for the political climate of the moment.
Maintaining FREEDOM of SPEECH is the most important issue at stake here and is severely compromised.
Without sound boundaries for online censorship which this legislation certainly does not deliver, FREEDOM of SPEECH, then DEMOCRACY will inevitably transition into Dictatorship.
